column2: Some Arabyans are so adept at camel riding that they kick their training up a notch and carry jezzails to battle. Now, that's a sight to remember - if you're not on the other side of their dreadful aim.

One major advantage the camel provides for these mounted archers is simply a better angle for their arrows to aim true than from their horse counterparts. Albeit, mounted archery on a camel is no easy task!
Trained from birth to ride these sturdy beasts, most camel riders can be traced to beduin origin. They know how to tame it, and best of all, they know how to bond with it.
